sen.j: 与謝 蕪村（よさ ぶそん、よさの ぶそん、享保元年（1716年） - 天明3年12月25日 (旧暦)（1784年1月17日））は、江戸時代中期の日本の俳人、画家。
sen.e: Buson YOSA (Kyouhou Year 1 (1716) to Tenmyou Year 3, 12/25 (January 17 1784)) was a Japanese haiku poet and painter in the middle of the Edo Period.
Buson YOSA (Born in 1716, died on January 17, 1784) was a Japanese haiku poet and painter in the middle of the Edo Period.
Buson YOSA (Born in 1716, died on January 17, 1784) was a Japanese haiku poet and painter in the middle of the Edo Period.

sen.j: 本姓は谷口、あるいは谷。
sen.e: His real surname was either TANIGUCHI or TANI.
His real surname was either TANIGUCHI or TANI.
His real surname was either TANIGUCHI or TANI.

sen.j: 「蕪村」は号で、本名や通称は不明。
sen.e: "Buson" was a pseudonym; and his real name is unknown.
"Buson" was a pseudonym; and his real name is unknown.
"Buson" was a pseudonym; and his real name is unknown.

sen.j: 「蕪村」とは中国の詩人陶淵明の詩「帰去来辞」に由来すると考えられている。
sen.e: It is thought that "Buson" was derived from Chinese poet Touenmei's poem Returning Home.
It is thought that the name "Buson" was derived from a poem by a Chinese poet, Touenmei, "Returning Home".
It is thought that the name "Buson" was derived from a poem by a Chinese poet, Touenmei, "Returning Home".

sen.j: 俳号は蕪村以外では「宰鳥」、「夜半亭（二世）」があり、画号は「春星」、「謝寅（しゃいん）」など複数の名前を持っている。
sen.e: He had other names besides Buson, including Saichou and Yahantei (II) as a poet, and Shunsei and Shain as a painter.
He had other names besides Buson, including Saichou and Yahantei (II) as a poet, and Shunsei and Shain as a painter.
He had other names besides Buson, including Saichou and Yahantei (II) as a poet, and Shunsei and Shain as a painter.

sen.j: 経歴
sen.e: Curriculum Vitae
Biography
Biography

sen.j: 摂津国東成郡毛馬村（ひがしなりごおり けまむら）（大阪市都島区毛馬町）に生まれた。
sen.e: Born in Kema village, Higashinari county, in the kingdom of Settsu (Osaka, Miyakojima-ku, Kema-chou).
Born in Kema village, Higashinari county, in the kingdom of Settsu (Kema-chou, Miyakojima-ku, Osaka).
sen.cmt: 現在の住所の表記法を修正。
sen.e: Born in Kema village, Higashinari county, in the kingdom of Settsu (Kema-chou, Miyakojima-ku, Osaka).

sen.j: 20歳の頃江戸に下り早野巴人（はやの はじん〔夜半亭宋阿（やはんてい そうあ）〕）に師事し俳諧を学ぶ。
sen.e: At the age of 20 he went to Edo and studied Haikai under Hajin HAYANO (Soua YAHANTEI).
At the age of 20 he went to Edo and studied Haikai under Hajin HAYANO (Soua YAHANTEI).
At the age of 20 he went to Edo and studied Haikai under Hajin HAYANO (Soua YAHANTEI).

sen.j: 日本橋石町「時の鐘」辺の師の寓居に住まいした。
sen.e: He stayed with his teacher near Toki-no-kane in Nihonbashi-ishichou.
He lived in the house that his teacher temporarily hired near Toki-no-kane bell tower in Nihonbashi-kokuchou.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現に修正。時の鐘の説明になる鐘楼という言葉を追加。日本橋石街の表記修正。
sen.e: He lived in the house that his teacher temporarily hired near Toki-no-kane bell tower in Nihonbashi-kokuchou.

sen.j: このときは宰鳥と号していた。
sen.e: Around that time he was known as Saichou.
Around that time he was known as Saichou.
Around that time he was known as Saichou.

sen.j: 寛保2年（1742年）27歳の時、師が没したあと下総国結城（茨城県結城市）の砂岡雁宕（いさおか がんとう）のもとに寄寓し、松尾芭蕉に憧れてその足跡を辿り東北地方を周遊した。
sen.e: In year 2 of Kanpou (1742), when he was 27 years old, he went to stay with Gantou ISAOKA in Yuuki in the kingdom of Shimousa (Yuuki City, Ibaraki Prefecture) after his teacher died, and came to like Bashou MATSUO so much that he followed in his footsteps on a trip to the northeast.

In 1742, when he was 27 years old, he went to live with Gantou ISAOKA in Yuuki in the kingdom of Shimousa (Yuuki City, Ibaraki Prefecture) after his teacher died, and admired Bashou MATSUO so much that he followed in his footsteps on a trip to the Tohoku region.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現に修正。西洋暦のみを使用。
sen.e: After his teacher's death in 1742, he went to live with Gantou ISAOKA in Yuki, the kingdom of Shimousa (Yuki City, Ibaraki Prefecture) at the age of 27. He admired Basho MATSUO so much that he followed in his footsteps on a trip to the Tohoku region.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: その際の手記を寛保4年（1744年）に雁宕の娘婿で下野国宇都宮（栃木県宇都宮市）の佐藤露鳩（さとう ろきゅう）宅に居寓した際に編集した『歳旦帳（宇都宮歳旦帳）』で初めて蕪村を号した。
sen.e: He first used the name Buson when he edited those notes into his Saitanchou (Utsunomiya Saitanchou) in Kanpou year 4 (1744), when he lived Rokyuu SATOU's house as Gantou's adopted son-in-law in Utsunomiya, in the kingdom of Shimotsuke (Utsunomiya City, Tochigi Prefecture).

He first used the name Buson when he edited those notes into his Saitanchou anthology (Utsunomiya Saitanchou) in 1744, when he lived in the house of Rokyuu SATOU who was Gantou's adopted son-in-law living in Utsunomiya, in the kingdom of Shimotsuke (Utsunomiya City, Tochigi Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 自然な表現に修正。歳旦帳の説明に歌集という言葉を追加。
sen.e: He first used the name Buson when he edited those notes into his Saitanchou anthology (Utsunomiya Saitanchou) in 1744 when he lived in the house of Rokyu SATO, who was Gantou's adopted son-in-law. He was living in Utsunomiya, in the kingdom of Shimotsuke (Utsunomiya City, Tochigi Prefecture).
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: その後丹後国、讃岐国などを歴遊し42歳の頃京都に居を構えた。
sen.e: Later he toured the kingdoms of Kango and Sanuki, and settled in Kyoto at 42.
Later he toured the kingdoms of Kango and Sanuki, and settled in Kyoto at 42.
Later he toured the kingdoms of Kango and Sanuki, and settled in Kyoto at 42.

sen.j: この頃与謝を名乗るようになる。
sen.e: Around that time he came to be known as YOSA.
Around that time he started to use the name, YOSA.
Around that time he started to use the name, YOSA.

sen.j: 母親が丹後与謝の出身だから名乗ったという説もあるが定かではない。
sen.e: There is one story that says he got this name because his mother was born in Yosa, in Tango; but it is not known for sure.
There is a theory that he got this name because his mother was born in Yosa in Tango; but the reason is not known.
There is a theory that he got this name because his mother was born in Yosa in Tango; but the reason is not known.

sen.j: 45歳頃に結婚し一人娘くのを儲けた。
sen.e: He married at 45 years of age and had one daughter, Kuno.
He married at 45 years of age and had one daughter, Kuno.
He married at 45 years of age and had one daughter, Kuno.

sen.j: 島原（嶋原）角屋で句を教えるなど、以後、京都で生涯を過ごした。
sen.e: He spent the rest of his life in Kyoto, teaching poetry at Shimahara Sumiya,among other things.
He spent the rest of his life in Kyoto, doing activities including teaching poetry at Shimahara Sumiya restaurant.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現に修正。島原角屋について、料亭という説明を追加。
sen.e: He spent the rest of his life in Kyoto, doing activities including teaching poetry at Shimahara Sumiya restaurant.

sen.j: 明和7年（1770年）には夜半亭二世に推戴されている。
sen.e: In Meiwa year 7 (1770) became the second leader of the Yahantei school.
In 1770, he became the second leader of the Yahantei school.
sen.cmt: 西洋暦のみを使用。自然な表現に修正。
sen.e: In 1770, he became the second leader of the Yahantei school.

sen.j: 京都市下京区仏光寺通烏丸西入ルの居宅で、天明3年12月25日（1784年1月17日）未明68歳の生涯を閉じた。
sen.e: His life came to an end after 68 years, before dawn on the morning of 12/25 of the 3rd year of Tenmyou (January 17, 1784) in his house on Karasuma East, Bukkouji Street, in Shimogyou-ku, Kyoto.
His life came to an end after 68 years, before dawn on the morning of January 17, 1784 in his house on Karasuma Nishi-Iru, Bukkouji Street, in Shimogyou-ku, Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 西洋暦のみを使用。住所を修正。
sen.e: His life came to an end after 68 years, before dawn on the morning of January 17, 1784 in his house on Karasuma Nishi-Iru, Bukkouji Street, in Shimogyou-ku, Kyoto.

sen.j: 辞世の句は「しら梅に明（あく）る夜ばかりとなりにけり」。
sen.e: His last poem was, "as dawn reveals white plums/all becomes only night".
His last poem was, "white plum blossoms/I know the dawn will break soon".
sen.cmt: 短歌の訳を以下を参考に修正。http://ship.nime.ac.jp/~saga/etexts/darling.htmlhttp://japanfestival.web.fc2.com/koyomi/jiseinoku.html
sen.e: His last poem was, "white plum blossoms/I know the dawn will break soon".
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 墓所は京都市左京区一乗寺の金福寺（こんぷくじ）。
sen.e: His grave site is at Kinpukuji in Ichijouji, Sakyou-ku, Kyoto.
His grave site is at Kinpukuji in Ichijouji, Sakyou-ku, Kyoto.
His grave site is at Kinpukuji in Ichijouji, Sakyou-ku, Kyoto.

sen.j: 作家論
sen.e: Author's Commentary
As a Haiku Poet
sen.cmt: 内容を正確に反映した表現に修正
sen.e: As a Haiku Poet

sen.j: 松尾芭蕉、小林一茶と並び称される江戸俳諧の巨匠の一人であり、江戸俳諧中興の祖といわれる。
sen.e: A master of Edo Haikai along with Bashou MATSUO and Issa KOBAYASHI, he is known as the restoration patriarch of Edo Haikai.
A master of Edo Haikai along with Bashou MATSUO and Issa KOBAYASHI, he is known as the restoration patriarch of Edo Haikai.
A master of Edo Haikai along with Bashou MATSUO and Issa KOBAYASHI, he is known as the restoration patriarch of Edo Haikai.

sen.j: また、俳画の創始者でもある。
sen.e: He is also the originator of Haiku painting.
He is also the originator of Haiku painting.
He is also the originator of Haiku painting.

sen.j: 写実的で絵画的な発句を得意とした。
sen.e: He was good at making realistic yet picturesque verses.
He was good at making realistic yet picturesque verses.
He was good at making realistic yet picturesque verses.

sen.j: 独創性を失った当時の俳諧を憂い『蕉風回帰』を唱え、絵画用語である『離俗論』を句に適用した天明調の俳諧を確立させた中心的な人物である。
sen.e: Distressed by the lack of originality in the Haikai of the time, he promoted a return to Bashou's style, and was instrumental in establishing the Tenmyou style that applied the concept of "departure from the ordinary", used in painting, to poetry.

Distressed by the lack of originality in the Haikai of the time, he promoted a return to Bashou's style, and was instrumental in establishing the Tenmyou style that applied the concept of "departure from the ordinary", used in painting, to poetry.

Distressed by the lack of originality in the Haikai of the time, he promoted a return to Basho's style. He was instrumental in establishing the Tenmyou style that applied the concept of "departure from the ordinary" used in painting and poetry.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 作品
sen.e: Major Works
Major Works
Major Works

sen.j: 春の海 終日のたりのたり哉
sen.e: The sea in spring/all day long rocking/rocking
The sea in spring/all day long rocking/rocking
The sea in spring/all day long rocking/rocking

sen.j: 柳散り清水涸れ石処々
sen.e: Willow leaves falling/water drying up/stones everywhere
Willow leaves falling/water in the brook drying up/stones everywhere
sen.cmt: 清水の部分をわかりやすく修正。
sen.e: Willow leaves falling/water in the brook drying up/stones everywhere

sen.j: 鳥羽殿へ五六騎いそぐ野分かな
sen.e: 5 or 6 riders hurrying/to Tobadono/an autumn storm
Five or six riders hurrying/to Tobadono/an autumn storm
Five or six riders hurrying/to Tobadono/an autumn storm

sen.j: 花いばら故郷の路に似たるかな
sen.e: Flowers and thorns/does it look like/a road back home?
Flowers and thorns/this road looks like the one back home
sen.cmt: 内容を正確に反映するよう修正。
sen.e: Flowers and thorns/this road looks like the one back home

sen.j: 不二ひとつうづみのこして若葉かな
sen.e: New leaves/all around, only Fuji/is left uncovered
New leaves/all around, only Fuji/is left uncovered
New leaves/all around, only Fuji/is left uncovered

sen.j: 牡丹散りて打かさなりぬ二三片
sen.e: Two or three/peony petals falling/do not fall on one another
Two or three/peony petals falling/and piling up on the ground
sen.cmt: 内容を正確に反映するよう修正。
sen.e: Two or three/peony petals falling/and piling up on the ground

sen.j: 夏河を越すうれしさよ手に草履
sen.e: The joy of crossing/a river in summer/sandals in hand
The joy of crossing/a river in summer/sandals in hand
The joy of crossing/a river in summer/sandals in hand

sen.j: ゆく春やおもたき琵琶の抱心
sen.e: Spring is passing/my heart is heavy/with thoughts of Biwa
Spring is passing/my heart is heavy/holding Biwa in the arm
sen.cmt: 内容を正確に反映するよう修正。
sen.e: Spring is passing/my heart is heavy/holding Biwa in the arm

sen.j: 易水にねぶか流るゝ寒かな
sen.e: An onion floating/in the Yasumizu/so cold
A leek floating/in the Ekisui river/so cold
sen.cmt: 易水、ねぶかを修正。易水は中国の川の名称なので、わかりやすくriverを追加。http://www.kangin.or.jp/what_kanshi/kanshi_A29_3.htmlhttp://www.01.246.ne.jp/~yo-fuse/bungaku/daikonno/daikonno.html
sen.e: A leek floating/in the Ekisui river/so cold

sen.j: 月天心貧しき町を通りけり
sen.e: The high moon/passes over/the poor town
The high moon/I pass through/the poor town
sen.cmt: 内容を正確に反映するよう修正。http://www.h3.dion.ne.jp/~urutora/buson.htmhttp://www.mitsubishielectric.co.jp/dspace/column/cw26_b.html
sen.e: The high moon/I pass through/the poor town

sen.j: さみだれや大河を前に家二軒
sen.e: Summer rain/by the river/are two houses
Summer rain/by the river/are two houses
Early summer rain/by the river/are two houses

sen.j: 菜の花や月は東に日は西に
sen.e: Flowers of rape/the moon in the east/the sun in the west
Flowers of rape/the moon in the east/the sun in the west
Flowers of rape/the moon in the east/the sun in the west

sen.j: 涼しさや鐘をはなるゝかねの声

How cool/the chimes/drifting away from the bell

sen.j: 古庭に茶筌花さく椿かな
sen.e: In an old garden/tea whisk flowers bloom/camellias
In an old garden/a tea whisk is placed like a flower/camellias

sen.e: In an old garden/a tea whisk is placed like a flower/camellias

sen.j: ちりて後おもかげにたつぼたん哉
sen.e: After petals fall/it stands a vestige/peony
After petals fall/it stands a vestige/peony

sen.j: あま酒の地獄もちかし箱根山
sen.e: The pit of sweet sake/is close by/Mount Hakone
Sweet sake/the hell is near/in Mount Hakone
sen.cmt: 内容を正確に反映させるよう修正。
sen.e: Sweet sake/the hell is near/in Mount Hakone

sen.j: 鰒汁の宿赤々と燈しけり
sen.e: Lit up/all in red/the abalone soup shop
The inn serving blowfish soup/is lit up/all in red
sen.cmt: 内容を正確に反映させるよう修正。鰒を修正。
sen.e: The inn serving blowfish soup/is lit up/all in red

sen.j: 二村に質屋一軒冬こだち
sen.e: One pawn shop/for two villages/a grove in winter
One pawn shop/for two villages/a grove in winter
One pawn shop/for two villages/a grove in winter

sen.j: 御火焚や霜うつくしき京の町
sen.e: Fires burning/the frost is beautiful/Kyoto town
Fires burning/the frost is beautiful/Kyoto town
Bonfires burning/the frost is beautiful/Kyoto town
sen.cmt: 「御火焚」で燃えるのは唯の火ではないので修正

sen.j: 寒月や門なき寺の天高し
sen.e: A wintry moon/the ceiling is high/at the temple without a door
A wintry moon/a temple without a gate/the sky is high
sen.cmt: 門を修正。天高しの天は、訳文では天井という言葉を使用しているが、実際は空を指すのではないだろうか。そのように修正。ただし、確認はとれていない。
sen.e: A wintry moon/a temple without a gate/the sky is high
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: さくら散苗代水や星月夜
sen.e: Cherry petals falling/rice seedlings planted/stars and moon at night
Cherry petals falling/water in a paddy field/stars and moon at night
Cherry petals falling/water in a paddy field/stars and moon at night
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 住吉に天満神のむめ咲ぬ
sen.e: At Sumiyoshi/Tenmanjin's plums/have not bloomed
At Sumiyoshi/plums of Tenman god/have bloomed
sen.cmt: 内容修正。住吉天満宮で作られた俳句であると思われる。天満神は天神(菅原道真）の別称なので、説明としてgodという言葉を添える。天満神の読み方はアマミツカミと書かれている資料もある。http://5.pro.tok2.com/~tetsuyosie/ooita/hayamigun/sumiyoshitenman/sumiyoshitenman.html
sen.e: At Sumiyoshi/plums of the Tenman god/have bloomed

sen.j: 上記のほか、蕪村の俳諧の門弟でパトロンでもあった寺村百池の家に伝わった絵画、短冊、書状等の遺品一括が「与謝蕪村関係資料」として重要文化財に指定されている（1987年指定、個人蔵）。
sen.e: In addition to those listed above, the collected paintings, poems, and letters that were passed on to the family of Buson's patron and Haikai student, Hyakuchi TERAMURA, being "materials related to Buson YOSA," have been designated an Important Cultural Asset (1987, Private Collection).

In addition to those listed above, the collected paintings, poems, and letters that were passed on to the family of Buson's patron and Haikai student, Hyakuchi TERAMURA, being "materials related to Buson YOSA," have been designated an Important Cultural Property (1987, Private Collection).
sen.cmt: 重要文化財の名称を修正。
sen.e: In addition to those listed above, the collected paintings, poems, and letters that were passed on to the family of Buson's patron and Haikai student, Hyakuchi TERAMURA, being "materials related to Buson YOSA," have been designated an Important Cultural Property (1987, Private Collection).
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 後世への影響
sen.e: Legacy
Influence on Later Generations
sen.cmt: 内容を正確に反映させるよう修正。
sen.e: Influence on Later Generations

sen.j: 蕪村に影響された俳人は多いが特に正岡子規の俳句革新に大きな影響を与えたことは良く知られている。
sen.e: Many Haiku poets have been influenced by Buson; but it is well known that he had an especially big influence on Shiki MASAOKA's Haiku reform.
Many Haiku poets have been influenced by Buson; it is well known that he had an especially big influence on the innovation of Haiku poems by Shiki MASAOKA.
Buson has influenced many Haiku poets. It is well known that he had an especially big influence on the innovation of Haiku poems by Shiki MASAOKA.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 旧暦12月25日は「蕪村忌」。
sen.e: The 25th day of the 12th month in the old calendar is Buson Day.
The 25th day of the 12th month in the old calendar is Buson Day.
The 25th day of the 12th month in the old calendar is Buson Day.

sen.j: 多く俳句がある。
sen.e: There are many Haiku about it.
There are many Haiku about it.
There are many Haiku about it.

sen.j: 蕪村忌に呉春が画きし蕪かな 正岡子規
sen.e: On Buson Day/Goshun painted/a turnip (Shiki MASAOKA)
On Buson Day/Goshun painted/a turnip (Shiki MASAOKA)
On Buson Day/Goshun painted/a turnip (Shiki MASAOKA)

sen.j: 蕪村忌の心游ぶや京丹後 青木月斗
sen.e: Playful in the spirit/of Buson Day/Kyotango (Getto AOKI)
sen.cmt: Kyotango is a city near Kyoto
sen.e: Playful in the spirit/of Buson Day/Kyotango (Getto AOKI)
